dt: {bc}to draw off (a liquid) without disturbing the sediment or the lower liquid layers
{bc}to pour (a liquid, such as wine) from one vessel into another
{bc}to pour out, transfer, or unload as if by pouring

et: New Latin {it}decantare{/it}, from Latin {it}de-{/it} + Medieval Latin {it}cantus{/it} edge, from Latin, iron ring round a wheel {ma}{mat|cant:4|}{/ma}
shortdef: to draw off (a liquid) without disturbing the sediment or the lower liquid layers
to pour (a liquid, such as wine) from one vessel into another
to pour out, transfer, or unload as if by pouring
